meta_data.title: Unified Framework for Low-Rank Regression and Matrix Factorization Methods in Recommendation Systems
meta_data.abstract: This paper explores the theoretical relationship between reduced-rank regression (RRR) and matrix factorization (MF) frameworks in recommendation systems. By deriving and comparing their closed-form solutions, we unveil their intricacies and uncover novel methods to optimize model flexibility and performance. Moreover, our novel learning algorithm offers a new means for efficient hyperparameter searching to amplify current linear recommendation models beyond their conventional boundaries.
meta_data.venue: Proceedings of the 2023 Conference on Advanced Data Analytics
meta_data.method name: Unified Low-Rank Regression and Matrix Factorization Framework

relate work.related papers: Charubook and Zhang 2019 delve into the intrinsic structure of recommendation systems and their evolution over 25 years.
relate work.comparisons with related methods: Our framework expands on Steck 2019 by providing a unified foundation for both RRR and MF methods, revealing more principal components than traditional MF approaches.

high_level_summary.summary of this paper: The paper introduces a unified approach combining low-rank regression and matrix factorization in recommendation systems, providing improved flexibility and performance for modern recommendation models.
high_level_summary.research purpose: To explore the theoretical foundations connecting low-rank regression and matrix factorization methods and develop enhanced learning algorithms for efficient hyperparameter discovery.
high_level_summary.research challenge: To potentially address the deviations in evaluation metrics observed between regression and matrix factorization in recommendation systems.
high_level_summary.method summary: A novel learning algorithm is proposed, allowing for systematic hyperparameter optimization and application to existing linear recommendation models. Regression and matrix factorization models are juxtaposed under a unified framework.
high_level_summary.conclusion: Our study shows the potential of low-rank regression to outperform matrix factorization methods via optimal utilization of principal components. Moreover, our learning algorithm significantly advances the efficiency of hyperparameter tuning, while benefiting adjacent models.

Method.description: This method integrates the strengths of low-rank regression and matrix factorization, introducing a learning algorithm optimizing models by identifying optimal hyperparameters efficiently.
Method.problem formultaion: Given a user-item interaction matrix, the task is to analyze and compare modern low-rank regression and matrix factorization methods, developing techniques to optimize and apply these efficiently.
Method.model: The unified framework models user-item interaction matrices by synergizing RRR and MF approaches, enabling robust personalization through calculated factorization.
Method.theoretical analysis: By focusing on singular value manipulation, the framework demonstrates how regression methods utilize more principal components compared to matrix factorization, potentially leading to performance advantages.
Method.complexity: Regression and matrix factorization models differ in complexity due to their parameter structure, with regression models demonstrating potential efficiency in parameter space.

Experiments.setup: Standardized experiment structures following protocols from previous studies in complex recommendation environments.
Experiments.results: The unified model yielded a noticeable accuracy boost over models solely reliant on matrix factorization. It also exhibited stability when using augmented parameter space for numerous datasets.
Experiments.performance: Demonstrating gains in nDCG and Recall metrics, the unified approach outperforms existing linear models, validating the synergy between regression and matrix factorization methods.
Experiments.analysis: The results substantiate that regression-based models possess inherent scalability, leveraging more principal components than MF models by effectively managing fewer trainable parameters.

conclusion.summary: This research presents a novel unified framework blending low-rank regression with matrix factorization, paving the way for further refinement of recommendation systems through direct manipulation of singular values and enhanced hyperparameter exploration that strengthens linear model capabilities.
conclusion.future work: Investigate further deep learning adaptations of the unified approach and explore real-world deployment gains of augmented linear models in industry scenarios.
